    • Method Detail

      • getHealthBar

        public javafx.scene.shape.Box getHealthBar()

      • twoDZombie

        public void twoDZombie(int zombieCounter,
                       int row,
                       int col,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Zombie> zombies,
                       int cellSize)
        Creates a circle object that represents a zombie drawn on a 2D board. It is given the initial x and y coordinates of the spawn point on the game map.
        Parameters:
        zombieCounter - The number of zombies to spawn.
        row - The row of the 2D game map.
        col - The column of the 2D game map.
        zombies - The list of Zombie objects.
        cellSize - The size of cells on the game map.

      • initiateZombieToRandomAngle

        public void initiateZombieToRandomAngle()
        Selects a random angle as the direction for the zombie to start moving.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        This method is called every time the animation time is called. A collision is checked for. If the zombie has collided with an obstacle, while the zombie is collided with that obstacle, move the zombie in the opposite direction out of that obstacle. If there is no collision, simply keep moving the zombie in the appropriate direction. Also, get the current position of the zombie for purposes of pathfinding. Check to see where the zombie is in relation to the center of the tile, and adjust accordingly to keep the zombie centered as it moves toward the player. This is to ensure that the zombie moves in the right directions at the right times. Without doing these checks, the zombie might move in a direction prematurely and needlessly hit obstacles. After these checks are done, the findPathToTargetFromTile method is called to find the shortest path to the player.
        Specified by:
        tick in class Entity

      • resetHeading

        public void resetHeading(Player p)

      • tick2d

        public void tick2d()
        This method does the same things that tick() does, but it is called for zombies that are being rendered on a 2D board.

      • stepSound

        public void stepSound()

      • calculateDistance

        public double calculateDistance()

        Returns:
